intro: Trichospermum leytense, commonly known as the Leyte starling tree, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptical in shape. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Trichospermum leytense is adapted to tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
